result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shedtina M Evans

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Shedtina M Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pre-trial conference. Parties report that case remains in trial posture. Case adjourned for jury trial on November 28th, 2022 before Branch 15.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 15. Court canceled the stayed bench warrant based on defendant's appearance in court.   Case adjourned for final pretrial and for jury trial in Branch 15  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Br. 15 is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case spun to Reserve Branch, Judge Wolfgram.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Final Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.

Case calenared for a Jury Trial on 8-24-2022. However, the court will not be in session due to a Judicial Conference.  
Parties notified via emai court vacated 8-24-2022 Jury trial and new date will be selected at the scheduled Final Pretrial on August 1, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference
Defense advises the court case is in trial posture and  request a final pretrial and jury trial dates. 
Court ordered parties to file their Pretrial documents 72 hours in advance of the final pretrial hearing.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Calendar Call. Defendant appears.  
Defendant advises the court she contacted the SPD Office and they indicated they will send her some documents to complete and return.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. 
DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court vacates stayed bench warrant that resulted from missing yesterday's court date. 
Defendant informs the court she has lost her job. Court orders defendant to contact the SPD's office to see if she is eligibile for public defender representation by the next court date.
Court ordered this case remains calendared for 4-7-2022 at 8:30am, IN PERSON.
Calendar call on April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR.
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner and no action on bail and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned. This hearing will be held in person, Room 623 of the courhouse., 
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Calendar call scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shedtina M Evans in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/10/22 @ 2p
